item.title: Nintendo Is Serving Up New Joy-Con 2 Controller Colors Just In Time For Mario Tennis Fever
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nintendo has unveiled its first set of new Joy-Con 2 colors: Light Purple and Light Green. These add a pastel accent to the controllers, and preorders for the $100 set--the same price as a standard set of Light Blue and Light Red Joy-Con 2 controllers--are now open ahead of their February 12 launch. Both controllers also come with matching wrist straps.

Nintendo Switch 2 Light Green and Light Purple Joy-Con 2 (2-Pack)

$100 | Releases February 12

This isn't a complete makeover of the Joy-Con 2, as the new color appears on the base of the thumbstick and the included wrist strap. This means that the colors will be hard to spot, unless you use one of the Joy-Con 2 controllers on their own during a multiplayer game like Mario Kart World.

The Joy-Con 2 controllers feature motion controls, improved HD Rumble, NFC support for Amiibo, and are slightly larger than the original Switch Joy-Cons. Mouse Mode is a new addition that lets you turn the controllers on their sides and use them like a computer mouse in compatible games like Metroid Prime 4, Fortnite, and Civilization 7.

You'll also find the new C button to access the Switch 2's GameChat feature on the right Joy-Con 2, and the magnetic connection lets them snap firmly into place on the console.

The controllers are also arriving just in time for Mario Tennis Fever, which will be released on the same day. Mario Tennis Fever's physical edition is up for preorder at Amazon, Walmart, Target, Best Buy, and GameStop. The game is also compatible with original Joy-Con controllers, and these are still readily available.

If you don't feel like waiting, you can pick up several other Switch 2 controller accessories. Individual left- and right-hand Joy-Con 2 controllers can be purchased, or, for something more traditional, the Switch 2 Pro Controller is a sturdy option for playing games. Like most things in life, these accessories saw their price increase last year. Nintendo raised the MSRP on most of its products by $5-$10 each.

Switch 2 Joy-Con 2 controller two-pack

  • Amazon -- $99
  • Target -- $100
  • Walmart -- $99
  • Best Buy -- $99
  • GameStop -- $100
  • Nintendo Store -- $100

  • Joy-Con 2 Controller 2-Pack -- $99

  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $54
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $54
  • Joy-Con 2 Straps (2-Pack) -- $14.88

Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller

  • Walmart -- $89
  • Amazon -- $89
  • Target -- $90
  • Best Buy -- $89
  • GameStop -- $90
  • Nintendo Store -- $90

Nintendo Switch controllers

  • Switch Pro Controller -- $79
  • Neon Pink and Neon Green Joy-Cons -- $88.80
  • Neon Purple and Neon Orange Joy-Cons -- $89
  • Neon Red and Neon Blue Joy-Cons -- $89
  • Pastel Pink and Pastel Yellow Joy-Cons -- $79
  • Pastel Purple and Pastel Green -- $84.55 ($90)

item.title: Arc Raiders A Warm Place To Rest Quest Guide
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Arc Raiders sends you on a handful of quests seeking out evidence of survivors, including A Warm Place to Rest. In this quest, you'll have to find any signs that raiders have survived topside near the Abandoned Highway Camp in Buried City. We'll tell you everything you need to know about this quest and how to complete it in this guide.

You don't need to extract to complete A Warm Place to Rest, but you will be trekking across the entire Buried City map to complete the objectives. With this in mind, a free loadout may not be your best bet, as you're rather likely to encounter raiders or ARC, which means you'll probably need extra healing items. It's your choice, of course, but we'd recommend bringing a decent gun or two, and enough heals to keep you trucking along safely.

When you're ready to finish A Warm Place to Rest, follow the steps below.

Locate the Abandoned Highway Camp

The Abandoned Highway Camp is located on the Buried City map just southeast of the Grandioso Apartments. Head onto the highway and look for a collection of buses.

When you arrive at the Abandoned Highway Camp, you'll be prompted to find any signs of survivors.

Search for any signs of survivors

Approach one of the buses to find a pack on the ground beside it.

Interact with this pack to trigger an objective that asks you to follow red markers.

Follow the red markers

These red markers in the sand can lead you across the entire map to the final objective of the quest. However, following these is not a necessary step if you already know where to find the objective. Given the tedious nature of following them, we'd recommend you just check below for the location of the grave on the far eastern side of the map, as that's where you'll need to go to wrap things up.

Once you arrive at this location in the Buried Properties, you'll be given the objective to inspect the nearby grave.

Inspect the grave

Amidst the rubble of this building is the grave you need to inspect.

Once you've interacted with the grave, you'll be free to head back to Speranza at your convenience. Of course, if you have any other Arc Raiders quests on Buried City, it's a good time to go ahead and knock them out while you're here. And for everything else, check out our comprehensive Arc Raiders guides hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/arc-raiders-a-warm-place-to-rest-quest-guide/1100-6537266/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Arc Raiders Lost In Transmission Quest Guide
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Arc Raiders occasionally sends you on quests that require you to enter areas that require a key. One of these quests, Lost in Transmission, asks you to head up into Spaceport's Control Tower A6, where you'll need to establish a connection from a terminal there. We're here to guide you through each step of this short but potentially dangerous quest.

There are two important things to note about this quest:

  • You must bring the Spaceport Control Tower Key into the raid. You will be granted this key upon accepting the quest, and you will not be able to open the necessary door and reach the terminal without it. Place the key in a safe pocket to ensure it's not lost during any potential firefights you encounter. If you didn't bring it or have already lost it, there's a chance someone else will have opened the door, but otherwise you'll need to acquire a new key, which can be found randomly as loot on any map.
  • Speaking of firefights, the locked room of Control Tower A6 tends to contain really good loot, so other raiders will often contest this location. If you're lucky, your visit to Control Tower A6 may end up quiet. But there's always a chance that you'll need to take someone out, so come prepared.

When you're ready to tackle Lost in Transmission, follow the steps below.

Visit Control Tower A6

Control Tower A6 is located in the lower middle of Spaceport. It's a tall, easily identifiable tower.

You can enter the building from any angle you prefer, including the opposite side, but we'd recommend entering directly where the tower is located.

Once you reach Control Tower A6, you'll be tasked with reaching the top of the building.

Reach the top of Control Tower A6

Inside the lower portion of Control Tower A6, you'll find that there are actually two locked doors. One locked door is in the main room accessed from the front of the building, while the other is in a room filled with red lockers and desks.

Both of these doors lead to the same zipline necessary to reach the top of Control Tower A6, but it's important to check that neither has been opened yet before you use your Spaceport Control Tower Key. If one is open already, then it's likely another raider has taken the zipline up to loot the room you need to access. It's up to you how to handle that situation--be it waiting for them to finish and leave, asking politely to visit for your quest, or simply taking the zipline up unannounced with intentions of slaying them and taking their loot.

When you reach the top of Control Tower A6, your objective will update once more, now requiring you to establish a connection from a nearby terminal.

Establish a connection from the terminal

At the top of Control Tower A6, check the left side of the room for a terminal. Interact with this to establish a connection, which will promptly complete the Lost in Transmission quest.

While you're here, it's a good idea to go ahead and loot everything in the room. This key room is one of the game's best for finding good stuff, so there's no reason to let it all go to waste. When you're done, just take the zipline back down and head to the extraction point of your choosing to travel back to Speranza.

For more on Arc Raiders quests and more, check out our comprehensive guides hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/arc-raiders-lost-in-transmission-quest-guide/1100-6537264/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Arc Raiders A Balanced Harvest Quest Guide
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Arc Raiders quests love sending players to the Research & Administration building on Dam Battlegrounds. One such quest, A Balanced Harvest, tasks you with visiting this hectic location and finding some files on a research project. Getting in and out can be tricky, so we've prepared a guide on how to finish your objectives as quickly as possible.

You can feel free to bring a free kit into Dam Battlegrounds for this quest, as you won't be required to extract. If you die in the very busy Research & Administration building--which you'll have to visit to complete your objectives--you certainly don't want to lose any good gear. That being said, if you're prone to enjoying PvP, you can always come more prepared for this PvP-centric POI. It's entirely your call, of course.

When you're ready to wrap up the A Balanced Harvest quest, read on for how to complete each step.

Go to the Research & Administration building

The first step in this quest is to head to the Research & Administration Building on Dam Battlegrounds.

This is a high-traffic area, primarily due to the fact that it contains some heavily contested key rooms, so it's not uncommon to encounter other raiders here. If your lobbies are particularly aggressive because you PvP frequently, you may find getting in and out of here alive can be a challenge. Prepare accordingly.

You can enter the Research and Administration from any angle, but it's most efficient for this quest to enter from the southwest entrance. This will lead you directly into the reception room. Here, you'll find that your objective updates, and you'll now be required to locate Lab 1 on the upper floor of the building.

Locate Lab 1 on the upper floor above the reception

From the reception room, head up the zipline on the back wall.

When you reach the top, take the path on your right.

Follow this around to the first door on your left. This is Lab 1.

Your objective will now update and ask you to find traces of the agricultural research project.

Search for any traces of the agricultural research project

Once you're inside Lab 1, you're nearly finished. Simply interact with the stack of papers on a desk in the middle of the room to find the trace of the agricultural research project.

With that done, you've completed A Balanced Harvest. You're now free to finish looting up here and extracting--or fighting to the death. That's your call, raider.

Whatever you decide to do, you can check out more Arc Raiders quests or take a look at our comprehensive guides hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/arc-raiders-a-balanced-harvest-quest-guide/1100-6537260/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Sales Were Reportedly Not Amazing Over The Holidays
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Nintendo Switch 2 was indisputably a sales hit after its June 2025 launch, but a new report indicates that the hybrid console's success may not match up to the original Switch's first holiday season.

According to The Game Business, Switch 2 sales in the United States were down by around 35% from November to December compared to Switch 1 sales during the same period in its launch year of 2017. This statistic tracks with an earlier report from Circana revealing that November 2025 was the worst month for hardware sales in the US since 1995.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: How Nintendo Won The Console War

The Switch 2 didn't fare much better in European countries, with UK sales having a reported fall of 16% compared to the Switch 1 in Holiday 2017. In France, Switch 2 unit numbers for its inaugural year are reportedly over 30% lower than what the Switch 1 achieved during its first year.

The difference is less steep in Japan, where the Switch 2 only had a 5.5% decline from Switch 1 holiday numbers in 2017. Overall, the Switch 2 still had a strong first year, with Switch 2 sales being higher than Switch 1's first-year sales in the UK (by 6%) and Japan (by 11%).

An unnamed "senior Nintendo employee" speaking to The Game Business attributed the slight decline to the "complicated economic landscape" and "the absence of a major Western game." During the holiday season, Nintendo itself published Kirby Air Riders, which has proven to be popular in Japan, and Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, which received a mixed response from fans.

Though hardware sales in general are faltering, that isn't to take away from the Switch 2's accomplishments, with over 10 million units sold in its first four months. Upcoming first-party Switch 2 offerings include an upgrade for Animal Crossing: New Horizons and the Baby Waluigi-starring Mario Tennis Fever.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
